DataElement.preferredName: Primary Site Surgical Procedure Excision Performed Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator for whether or not resection was performed at primary site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Primary Site Surgical Procedure Excision Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._A position in relation to its surroundings._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:A position in relation to its surroundings.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
A position in relation to its surroundings.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
